intro: Staurogyne dolichocalyx, commonly known as the long-stalked waterwheel plant, is a species of aquatic plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its whorled arrangement of leaves and a distinctive, spirally coiled inflorescence. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in marshes and ponds. Its flowers are small and typically white or pale green, and it produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Staurogyne dolichocalyx plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and small fish.
